alert.note: Alert for Eastern Aleutians (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Watch issued February 18 at 4:43AM AKST until February 20 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Southeast winds 50 to 65 mph with gusts up to 75 mph possible. * WHERE...Eastern Aleutians. * WHEN...From late Saturday night through Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...High winds could move loose debris, damage property, and cause power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High levels of uncertainty still exist on the exact track of a strong low pressure system expected to move from the north Pacific into the central Bering. Current solutions have a 50 to 75 mile wide area of 75 mph or greater winds arriving east of the low center somewhere between Adak and Nikolski. Should the storm track shift farther to the east, Unalaska may be impacted.
info.instruction: A high wind watch means there is potential for a hazardous high wind event. Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.
